page.title: 11Leather: Pittards of Yeovil.
page.content: { Pittards}is a large modern factory for processing leather,carrying on a Yeovil tradition over 600 years old. Opened in 1965 this industry is close to the River Yeo,very important because of the large volume of water needed.{Pittards employ 326 people. The leather skins come from all over the world,e.g. Spain,Sudan,Bangladesh and Ethiopia. Once the raw skins arrive they are dressed i.e. the wool and loose flesh is removed. Other processes include degreasing, tanning, skating, dyeing, pickling, buffing, polishing and measuring. 62% is for shoes, 30% for gloves and 8% for clothing. Leather is still the best because it is soft, strong durable yet comfortable.{Pittards is an up to {date leather producer with a turnover {of 34.8 million pounds, 70% going for {export.
